alert.note: Alert for East Carteret (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 8:48PM EDT until May 28 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM FRIDAY TO 10 AM EDT SUNDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM FRIDAY TO 8 PM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, dangerous rip currents, large breaking waves, and strong longshore currents in the surf zone north of Cape Lookout. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, 2 to 3 of inundation above ground level expected in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 6 to 10 feet expected in the surf zone along Core Banks. * WHERE...East Carteret County. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Friday evening. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 10 AM Friday to 10 AM EDT Sunday. For the High Surf Advisory, from 5 PM Friday to 8 PM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Dangerous shore break can throw a swimmer or surfer head first into the bottom causing neck and back injuries. Strong longshore currents will create dangerous swimming conditions.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
